Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice compact size
Cons: If you never used tablet, takes a few minutes to learn how to operate..
I bought this 7.0 Galaxy after returning my Black Berry Playbook.
Cons: Takes a little while to learn how to maneuver it if you never used a tablet.
Pros: The screen size is great. It comes with 16 GB built in and can hold up to a 32 GB micro sd card. Good battery life. Great app seletion on Android Maket. Great sound and picture quality.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Adequate Storage; Good Compatibility; Easy To Use; Fast; Compact Design; Long Battery Life
This is my first Tablet and I couldn't have asked for more! Compact but great clarity on the screen, fast as my laptop without the bulk and even though I am not a major gamer, this rocks!
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Size and weight
This is my second Android tablet, Motorola Xoom being the first. I rarely use the Xoom anymore after purchasing the Galaxy 7.0plus. Not because it is necessarily better than the Xoom, but the size is just plain handy. I usually wear a vest or jacket, and the 7.0+ easily fits in an inside pocket on the apparel I own. Heck, it will even fit in the front pocket of my jeans, not that I would carry it there.
The 7.0+ is very light and easy to hold. Sometimes I forget it's in my vest pockets and I have to double check that I didn't leave it somewhere.
I'm glad Samsung included a microSD slot on this tablet, unlike some of the other Galaxy tablets. I use the card for movies and it works great for that purpose.
The floating mini-apps are great. The ... y are accessed on the bottom taskbar. There are 6 apps available. The mini-app doesn’t fill the entire screen so you can see another app behind it. You can manipulate both apps. The best example I have is a pricelist I have in PDF format. I can open the price list and then launch the calculator mini-app. I can scroll through the pricelist in the background while the calculator stays open in the foreground to be used to add up the prices I’m looking up on the PDF.
I haven’t used the Kies software to sync the tablet with computer so I can’t comment on the trouble others have had. Most of the file transfer I do is direct from computer to microSD card. I stream music from the Google Music cloud storage. I do have some of my music from the cloud set to be available for offline use and it hasn’t seemed to fill up the 16GB available.
I installed a Zagg Invisible shield. Mostly I carry the 7.0+ naked, but sometimes I put it in a portfolio case that was packaged for a Kindle Fire. The 7.0+ fits just fine in the case; it uses elastic straps in the corners. One limitation is not being able to use the main camera in the Fire case.
I haven't had any operational issues with the 7.0+ tablet.
The one complaint I can think of is that for so ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: i love my tab.i have found that samsung makes HIGH quality products.battery life is 6hours w/o plug. easy to learn browser. clear camera. VERY lightweight. sleek, but the screen is big. great product

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I have used the Galaxy Plus 7.0 for about two weeks now and find it easier than I first thought to work with. Battery life is what was advertised and it seems quite easy to modify to suit my needs. I like the option of an expansion slot and the 7 inch size allows me to carry it in my pocket when I need to without having to use a briefcase. I found using a stylus helps and a case was a necessity since I sometimes drop things. Only suggestion is a larger sized manual with more instructions on how to use all the features. I'm sure its online but I'd like a complete paper manual. Great Product!
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent Display,Light Weight, Good Battery Life
Cons: Nothing at this time.
Performance was a disappointment. 7.0 Plus would randomly turn off, Netflix would freeze up and make a loud squealing noise and I would have to reset the device because I could not turn the power off. Apps would also freeze up. I returned it and got the 8.9 Tab and what difference. The 8.9 is almost perfect, Awesome screen, Resposive and Fast, Solid build.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Good Quality Product for the Price...
Item.Review:
Pros: Makes a perfect eReader, good processor, excellent screen, external SD access.
Cons: Rear Camera could be better!
Perfect for traveling, you can add all kinds of electronic reading apps to it. I'm using the eBooks app, Kindle app, Nook app, Google Books app, plus you can add the Quick Office HD app which is compatible with all versions of Microsoft Office to include; Word, Excel & PowerPoint. Email accounts are very easy to set-up. The screen Graphics are outstanding for the size. Netflix movies look outstanding on this beautiful screen with the HD playback. You can sync your itunes music using the doubleTwist app. The WiFi internet connection is faster than my Toshiba Netbook. It has an micro SD slot for adding more storage. I currently have a 16gb card for a total ... of 32gb space, but you can add up to 32gb card for a total of 48gb storage capacity. In summary, this is the perfect 7" Tab for traveling and reading books indoor or outdoor, unless you have eyesight problems, in that case, consider the Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9". Other than that, I am very satisfied with the product. If it's a money issue, I recommend the Acer Iconia A100. If you want something bigger and powerful, and you can afford it, consider the new Asus Transformer Prime. (The iPad is overrated) Good luck with your Tablet hunting! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Slow- quirky- bad Battery Life - Returned for Fire
Item.Review:
Pros: Size and color
Cons: Slow. Battery Life. Quirky
Was excited about this unit at first. But after using it about 10 days I returned it to Best Buy and replaced it with a cheaper Amazon Fire which I love. The Fire does more than the Galaxy and its battery life is better. Galaxy has some good features but it's way too slow, has a quirky on/off switch that turns off at inopportune times if you hit it by accident. That was rectified by the purchase of a case which covered the on/off switch better. But that's an ineffective design. Its battery life is extremely poor. On top of that, it's not an intuitive set up and forget trying to find a manual. Samsung Galaxy has alot of work to do before I'd consider this unit again. And, I'm a Samsung fan. The Size of the tablet is e ... xcellent compared to the Ipad. You can toss it into a backpack or purse. The 7 inch screen gives you more viewing area than the typical Smart-Phones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Small and light with a fast processor
Cons: Frequently slips into a sleep of death and is difficult to wake up.
I purchased the tablet for my wife as a Christmas present and we've both been disappointed by the performance from day one. There seems to be a bug where the tablet shuts down and doesn't want to start up again. There have been times when I didn't know if it would ever come back on again. The battery life seems to be OK. Another annoying feature is related to the software buttons on the device. Android is moving away from physical buttons. While this might sound great, the reality is actually annoying. First, the buttons are relatively small. When resting in a leather case, those buttons can be difficult to access with larger fingers. The second annoying featu ... re is that when watching television via Sling, or Netflix, the software buttons are always visible. Instead of a nice clean screen with your show, you always see the show AND the software buttons.
The screen, while decent, certainly does not compare to my Galaxy SII and its Super Amoled screen. It could also be a bit brighter in sunlight, in my opinion.
I still prefer my HTC Flyer over this particular tablet. It might be a couple ounces heavier, but the battery life seems to be better, the screen seems to be brighter, and the buttons on the Flyer are far superior to the Galaxy Tab. After playing with this Samsung for a while, I decided I liked the Flyer so much that I purchased a 2nd Flyer simply as a backup last night.
While I love my Sammy SII phone, the Tab simply has too many shortcomings for me to recommend it as a great device to own at this point. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, easy to set up, nice screen
Cons: Wifi is very weak
I was looking forward to getting this tablet. I couldn't wait. I finally was able to find it in stock yesterday. Almost everything about it is great. The screen is amazing. It's bright and crisp. I've seen complaints about honeycomb, but I had no problems with it at all. My only other Android device is an Evo, so it took a bit of getting used to the differences. But I was fully up and running with a complete understanding of the tablet in less than an hour. The only problem I had with it is the Wifi. I don't know if it is is a problem with just the one that I have, or if it is a problem in general. If I am standing in front of the router with the tab aimed at the router, I get full bars. If I turn my back on the ... router, it drops one bar. If I walk twenty or so feet away, it loses another bar. I also have an iPad2 and an iPod. I tested it against the wireless capabilities on the iPad, iPod, and my Evo, and none of those suffer from the Wifi attenuation like my tab. In areas where the Galaxy Tab could not connect, my other wireless devices showed full signal, and were able to connnect and browse at full speed. I noticed that if I moved my hands a bit around it, I got a better signal. But the signal was the absolute worst when I had both hands holding it at the bottom. That is naturally where I hold a device of this size.
I am very sad. I was really looking forward to this purchase. But I have no real use for a tablet with flaky Wifi. I wonder if this is an issue with the positioning of the Wifi antenna, or if it is just a weak antenna. I wonder if it is a problem with all Galaxy Tab 7.0 units, or just the one that I had. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: A month in, I love it, But.....
Item.Review:
Cons: Peel is not great. Price could be a bit better.
Pros: The screen is bright (once you take it off auto dim) clear and vibrant.
Surfing the web is as good as it gets on a tablet. It is fast and clear.
The Sound is amazing, compared to the Nook and even the Ipod it is Amazing. You don't have to have external speakers to hear it in a semi-busy location.
I love that I am not locked into buying books from limited sources. surfing the net is as good as it gets for a tablet.
The size fits into my purse so it is handy to pull out no matter where I am having to stand in line.
Auto rotate is nice but it can also be disabled easily, which is nice at times.
The design feels solid. Cons: The charger cable is only 3 ft long! So reading an ... d charging at the same time is difficult, - so far no reliable after market longer cords available that I can find.
The ability to be a remote control would be a neat idea, but the Peel program just doesn't work .. programs don't match up, randomly shuts off your TV instead of changing the channel. Support for Peel is HORRIBLE . They will not call or do any sort of live support..it is all through email. I have been talking to support the whole time via email.. and they are Slooooooooow in replying. I have given up on Peel even though it was one of the main features that was being advertised at the time.
After market goodies are a bit lacking, but I am hoping that will come along with time.
Lastly, the power button is quite close to the volume buttons. It would have been better to set the spacing a bit differently. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: everything
Cons: not a thing
OK...I have been looking at tablets and even bought the pandigital before just waiting until my birthday/christmas. What a present. I cant say how much I love this tablet. Set up is super easy, just connect to wifi, it prompts you for your google account and boom! All your things on your phone are on your tablet, like how sweet is that??? I havent had any problems, although I just got it last night. The screen is repsonsive and quick, The package includes headphones and those are really nice, someone called them earbuds...they are comfortable. Hook up charger is easy. Samsung just made this thing just plain easy to use and love. Had a blast with the peel app. Husband was watching t.v. and I turned it off. He turned it on, I turned i ... t off. Wicked fun. Anyway, if you want something thats easy to deal with, this is it. I cant imagine wanting something bigger. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
After reading all of the reviews and checking out all of the tablets I could get my hands on for the last few months, I decided to get the 7" Plus from Samsung and I'm not disappointed.
It's thin and light, yet feels rock solid. It's very fast and almost everything works perfectly well.
What's excellent: SIZE SHAPE and WEIGHT Honeycomb 3.2 works great Solid build Touch sensitivity Screen resolution and color: HD SD card slot GPS Speakers: somewhere between excellent and good for something THAT small. Not bad at all.
What's good: Battery life is GOOD, but could be better. Not a problem. On/Off switch and volume rocker: Somewhat easy to hit by accident, but still not a big deal. TV controller (Peel): Sort of works most of the time. It's t ... he only buggy thing on my unit, but still kinda cool. Update???
What's OK: Voice to texT doesn't worK so hood. Price: But I still paid it b/c this is the best 7" out there right now.
The soon coming 7.7" Samsung will be better but surely even more expensive and maybe not worth it. The 8.9" is awesome but reportedly buggy and definitely not built as well. The coming HTC Flyer will probably be VERY close but likely heavier. The Acer 7" is reportedly buggy also and has an odd shape. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for an e-reader, games, and checking e-mail.
Item.Review:
Pros: I like the smaller size.
Cons: I would like to find a gel cover for it.
Easy to hold compared to the larger tablets. Since I have an android phone, I can add the same apps to my tablet. I have 5 different e-readers, assorted games, and several different e-mail accounts. I can listen to the radio, watch Netflix, and check Facebook as well. I just wish I could find a gel skin like I have for my phone, because I am afraid I will drop it.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, external storage
I never really understood the point of a tablet until I booked an upcoming trip, where I will be gone for 2 weeks between the US and Europe for pleasure and am trying to only bring carry ons. I decided I wasn't going to bring my laptop because it's too heavy and the battery sucks. So, I got this. It's an awesome size (the same size as my Kindle with the keyboard). It fit in my boyfriends back pocket. I don't intend on carrying it in a pocket, but if someone wearing mens pants really wanted to, they could. I really liked the fact that you can add storage, unlike most other tablets I looked at. I haven't had any problems with it freezing or being super slow like some other reviews have said. There was a slight learning curve on how to use it, since I'm ... used to my iPhone. The battery life seems pretty good between watching movies on it and playing games. Standby time is great. I don't think battery life is as good as advertised, but that also depends on the individual settings. Another thing I'm used to is having a universal charger for any Apple product. Samsung doesn't seem to do this (the thingy is different than my boyfriends Galaxy S). Overall, I'm pretty darn happy with this thing :) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: LOVE THIS TABLET! Glad I didn't drink the AppleAid
Item.Review:
I have an iPhone 4 so I've got nothing against Apple, but something never sat right with me using and potential purchasing the iPad. It's too expensive to get in to the entry level iPad, there's only one model (in terms of size, shape, etc.) and Apple is pretty controlling (i.e. we know what you want better than you do). I went ahead and took a chance on the Samsung Tab 7.0 Plus and I love it. I'll keep the rest of the review simple.
Pros: -IR to remote control TV / DVR / Blu ray is an awesome and unique feature. -Fits in one hand in portrait mode (iPad can't do this) and is a lot lighter to hold in one hand in landscape. -Cheap! Got it for $249 on sale. -Specs. We're talking spreadsheets here people. I'm very thorough. Best bang for your buck. -Screen has higher ppi ... than iPad 2. The iPad 2's screen was just a little too blurry. I don't need super HD like the iPad 3, but I need something a little sharper than the iPad 2. This meets my sharpness expectations. -It will get Android Ice Cream Sandwich (soon I hope). -Lite compared to competition. -"Unlocked" (i.e. full Android tablet) unlike Kindle Fire and B&N Nook. -Easy to carry and pack.
Neutral: -Not as much accessories as say an Apple product (I found some on Amazon and eBay), but that's also why I bought it. I voted with my purchase and I voted Samsung...which may mean more accessories for future products.
Semi-Cons: -Battery life SEEMS less than engadget.com's claimed 8h9min, but I've never tested it. I'd say it's easily 5 to 7 hours of use before you have to start worrying. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Display, size
Cons: Android 3 not so easy to use
Beautiful display, difficult to use, not intuitive. Returned after 10 days. Bought Ipad 2 love it! Only recommend to experienced Android users

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Its the perfect size.
Cons: Battery could be better.
I love this tablet. It does everything I wanted it to do. I use it for reading ,e-mail , face book, web purchases , videos, and more. I wouldn't want to be without it. I can get about 8 hours of battery use .

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: battery life, compact
Cons: lack of cases
I've dithered for weeks over tablet and e-readers, and finally settled on this one, thanks in part to the $50 price drop. It is a nice size and works well for book reading and light web surfing. The battery life is great: I drop in my bag and forget it for days (WiFi off!) and it still has high charge. I wish my phone lasted like that. Finding a case for it is hard; I could just take a Kindle Fire case (they fit it quite well), but all involve compromises - no camera openings, covered ports, etc. My main gripe is (probably) not the fault of the hardware, but the OS: Honeycomb dropped the dedicated Menu button, and now Astro File Manager is semi-crippled with no Menu button and no Action bar that is supposed to substitute for it ... in Honeycomb-optimized apps. Oh yes: when I first set up my GT7+, it automatically installed most of the same apps that I have on my Galaxy S phone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: This is a great Android Tablet at a great price
Item.Review:
Pros: compact lightweight and powerful device for its form factor
Cons: hard to find accessories in local store must order online
This tablet is a great device running the Android Honeycomb OS. Even though the screen size is only 7" it has excellent picture quality. I also am impressed with the sound quality. This device is small, lightweight and very portable. This device actually has better sound quality than a larger tablet that I had recently purchased. This tablet is also very snappy and the apps run very well on it. The games/graphics look great on this tablet also despite the smaller screen. The one thing that I was dissappointed is that Hulu Plus does not work with this device but after research I think that it is not the hardware but the app itself needs to be update ... d to work with the newer Android operating systems. This is a great tablet for music as well. The tablet comes pre installed with netflix but I use Hulu just my personal preference. This tablet is a very compact powerful yet inexpensive tablet.Get your root on! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: ereader, web browser, multitasker,
Cons: charging port, can't sync to computer without downloading SAMSUNG Kies
So after my iPad 1st Gen died it was time to look for a new tab. I thought that i was going to buy the iPad 2. until i walked into a best buy. i saw the Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus and had to have it! there are pros & cons about this tab....
CONS: you can't sync your tab to your Mac/Pc without downloading SAMSUNG Kies to transfer music, movies, photos, ETC. ( i have a mac and use bluetooth to transfer stuff over its easy but kills battery life)
A lot of tabs now have a charging port and a MINI HDMI port.... well not this one the 7.0 plus only supports the 16 pin charger port witch means if you want to connect your tab to the tv you gotta b ... uy the adapter GRRR!
PROS:
its size is perfect for ereading. comes with 16 GB built in and can hold up to a 32 GB micro sd card. honeycomb works grate bluetooth has a GREAT range. the battery Life is the best. front facing cam can be better but recording video on the rear cam is good same with sound! Peal remote is fantastic i control my 2 TVs, Home theater system, Apple TV, 2 Comcast Boxes.
If your like me and you like to Download Music, watching movies while waiting for the girlfriend to deciding which shoe to buy, Note taking, recording video here and there (family events friends falling on there Butt) browsing the web, and customizing your screens without Jailbreaking!!!!
then this is a great tab! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Seems easy to use.
Cons: I find keyboard hard for me to use because fo size.
I waited and compared tablets for over a year and was anxiously waiting for the galaxy 7.0 plus. I finally have it, and the only thing I don't like is I feel the keyboard is too small for my fingers, even in landscape view. To be fair, I haven't used it much to it's full potential so I can't comment on anything else. I would recommend this talble if you're looking for a smaller tablet and want to spend under $300.00

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: Let me first start by saying that i have an htc desire an iconia tab and that my mum has an ipad so i am able to compare to a few devices. I bought this for three reasons, despite what steve jobs says, i find a 10inch tablet too heavy to lug around, my two year old daughter is forever using my other tab to watch kids programs and i also really liked the idea of the remote built in as i have an htpc under the tv and am always searchingfor a perfect remote for it and the tv. The pros Nice design and build quality Very light Fast The headphones included are surprisingly good Ir blaster - the peel software is not my favourite but i think someone is likely to bring out an alternative at some stage giving you a device that can control an entire entertainment system and a computer (via remo ... te droid or similar) Micro sd card slot and usb adapter (not included but at least avaliable) Lovely screen (but not as bright as iconia and the auto adjust is rubbish) Sound quality - excellent via headset and pretty good for a tiny device with a little speaker Bluetooth 3 - i cant wait for a few people to start releasing compatible headsets. The quality should be good enough to listen to music without compromising on quality but with the convenience of no wires. Small enough to fit in my cargo pants pocket Perfect size for a two year old to hold when watching her programs Cons Peel software is tricky and not intuitive to set up- i have the basic tv functions but my harmon kardon avr 130 isn't doing much- i havent put much time into it yet and the onlinehelp is quick to respond. I wish they'd just include a manual way of configuring certain buttons to do certain things. Maybe someone will come up with an app for this. I should also mention that i am in australia and can confirm that the software works fine without the programming guide. Battery can drain quickly - battery life is a bit variable and can last from 4 hours to several days depending on usage. You have to be careful to shut background apps (very easy with a samsung active apps live widget) Screen is a bit small to surf the web comfortably so i use the 10 inch tab in preference (but used to leavethe larger tab at home because of size and weight) Not as good as the galaxy 7.7 unless you need the remote (but cheaper by $150 at time of purchase) Lags badly when searching for music. A weird thing is that it is a very responsive tab except when typing to search for music. There is a bad (2 second per keypress) lag. It can also be slow to flip the screen from landscape to portrait or vice versa. Not a deal breaker but something that i hope they fix in an update. Proprietary cable Charger is 2 amp so it wont charge and run on any of my other usb adapters. At least it tells you though in the control panel that its not charging. You can charge on other chargers though if you turn the device off. Selecting items on web browser can be finicky - it really needs you to press exactly the right place, s9metimes tough on a small screen Overall an excellent device and well worth the money expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Good size, nice feature set
Cons: Relatively expensive; 30-pin connector instead of USB; Samsung Sense UI
Caveat: I upgraded from a rooted Nook Color (7" Android 2.1 tablet) to this device. My expectations are based on my Nook Color experience.
Pros:
Size - the 7" seems to be the sweet spot for me. Comfortable for me to carry around; fits easily into a bag.
Weight - noticeably lighter than my Nook Color.
Connectivity - USB through the 30-pin connector. Integrated Bluetooth & GPS as well as WiFi. Easy access to on-off toggles for bluetooth, gps, wifi, sound, etc
Front and rear-facing cameras
SD Card Slot - up to 32Gb MicroSD
Honeycomb OS
Samsung Kies: This is a computer program that you can use to manage content ... you put on your Tab. It is kind-of an iTunes wanna-be, but at least provides a mechanism for managing playlists and other content, in addition to the standard access through USB connection.
Cons:
A bit expensive: This costs almost twice as much as the NookColor and costs twice as much as the Amazon Fire. It has much better connectivity and flexibility than either of the above, but the price difference still seems pretty big.
30-Pin connector instead of USB connector: You can connect and charge using this connection, but need a special purpose connector. The cable packed with the device is also VERY short - about 30". The iPod 30-pin connector will not work with the Tab. This means more money transfers from me to the cable vendors and more stuff to pack into my cable bags.
2-Amp Samsung charger requirement: You can charge this device using a regular USB port, but it will report that it is not charging and the charge will be very slow. If you buy a non-Samsung 2 Amp USB power source, it charges fine but still reports that it is not charging.
Samsung Sense UI: This layer provides me with quick access to Samsung Apps that I neither need nor use. I cannot change the contents of the quick access dock to provide more useful apps. The Sense UI seems to interfere with the ability of Android timer/countdown apps to provide audible alarms. My "reboot" widget do ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Nice Tablet! Wife loves it...
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, screen, responsiveness, premium feel
Cons: The IR remote software needs a bit of work
This is a very well built tablet quality wise. Purchased as a replacement for my wife's Nook Color for Christmas. She absolutely loves it and I can't pry it from her hands It's responsive, solid build (nice to hold), expandable memory, beautiful screen (better than the Nook, which is also very nice) and great form factor. The only fault I can find is with the IR remote. It's a bit glitchy, but still in early stages and can probably be fixed with firmware & software updates. Needless to say my wife doesn't care about this feature. If you're looking for a premium 7" tablet for a decent price I think this is the one for you.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: As much as I love Samsung products...This is bad.
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice form factor, Good looking screen, Samsung provided Apps
Cons: Everything else.
I had to return this device because there are just so many issues with it that I just can't get behind it. I really wanted to like this product but I really couldn't, From issues with the Peel App to random screen cut offs I found myself getting more and more frustrated.
Pros:
Not all was bad; Form fact is good, the screen is nice and big, and Android Honeycomb was running ok with no issues but I seen better performance with my Samsung Galaxy S II. I wasn't really happy with it but I figured "Ok, maybe I can live with just the tad slow down." Android had a host of apps within it store and the Samsung provided apps was great from Email to Social hub I really enjoyed. All Sha ... re and the Music app was my favorite...sadly the Pros of this product stops here.
Cons:
I am heartbroken that this wasn't the device I was looking for. It seems like a good idea that was poorly executed in the tablet world. First the Peel app is horrible, its pretty bad and it randomly shuts off my TV when I turn to a channel. I did the set up 10 times to make sure and even restored the device. While I wasn't expecting it to rival Logitech harmony it would have been nice just to have a coffee table tablet. I figured again "Ok I can live look this problem too...no big deal." oh and battery life isn't that stellar.
Downloaded a few apps including Samsung own TV app for my Samsung 2011 Smart TV. The Ratio for the screen were all wrong and it just so happens with so many tablet apps too within android market. Most of the Apps didn't even fit the screen well at all because they pretty much seem like they are all meant for 10 inch screens. Tried to download a few Gameloft Games and nothing was compatible with my device. At this point I started looking for reasons to keep this device in my home and when ever something becomes to that point that means its bad to keep it but still I tried to maintain my love for this device. That is until The screen on the device cuts off and never turned back on agai ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Size and performance
Cons: Compared to a dozen others.....nothing!
Having owned and disposed of about a dozen different tablets, including the GT 10.1, I think I might have finally found the right one. I actually loved the 10.1 but got tired a hauling it's big body around. The 7 Plus gives me everything the 10.1 did, except it's weight and bulk, and even fits in my pants pocket if necessary. Yeah, watching movies isn't as nice, but that's not one of my big things anyway. As a matter of fact, my wife accuses me of having a high dollar Kindle, since most of what I do is read. Anyway, performance is great, colors brilliant, and since it's going to be upgraded to ICS, I'm a happy camper.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: When it comes to hardware, Samsung is boss in the Android tablet and phone space, and the 7.0 Plus delivers on quality, design and performance. This tablet is lightweight, almost as comfortable to hold as the Kindle 3 (keyboard), and very fast with video and web browsing. Magazines look great on the 7" screen in both portrait and landscape and are surprisingly comfortable to read despite the limited screen real estate.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Cons: Don't know since it only lasted 4 days.
I bought this because of the size but within a week this device die on me and had to ask for refund. I only used about 4 days and only thing I can say is battery life is very short.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Deal on the Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus!
Item.Review: Great deal on this refurbished tablet... it s actually new, but all the fancy/pretty retail packaging is replaced by a plain brown box. The unit is great, so I m very happy. I m looking for Samsung s own warranty extension deal instead of all these third party shops pitching here... it s probably online after registration, which I haven t attempted yet...

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Cons: Crashes often with no way to pull the battery out.
Got my wife a Samsung galaxy tab for Christmas. Although the battery life was not great, seemed to be a good buy until a few weeks ago when it just wouldn't turn on. Sent it out to Samsung and they sent it back a couple weeks later working, claiming there was nothing wrong with it. We are now going through it again and I am totally regretting not getting her an IPad (I have one from work and have never had any problems). Take my word for it, spend the extra $ and get an IPad.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: see review above..
Cons: brightness control, no micro HDMI, price
I like: design, performance, durability, battery life, keyboard, sound, external sd, thin, light & the technology of samsung over all neat and great (and I liked the charger design and the headphone than included!)
did not like: NO micro HDMI !!, brightness control annoying (it never settle even when you deselect auto! and the price value of it should be no more than 260 $ !
I compared it to Acer iconia A100.. this one is better in overall !!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: The size and ability to add memory without buying cloud space.
Cons: Nothing so far.
I own an iPad 2, iPod touch and had an iPhone the upgraded to the Motorola razor with saying all this. I love my gadgets and adding the Samsung galaxy 7.0 plus just made my collection complete. I'm able to sync my phone with it and I love it. Thank you Samsung. I'm still learning more and more functions with it and a lot of my co-workers have fell in love with it and making their own purchases, so kindle fire step aside. By the way I had one of them too and sold it for the Samsung tablet.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: The most reliable 7 inches I have.
Item.Review: I use it to travel, wanted a small but yet powerful tablet and I found it. If size matters then get a bigger one, but if its portability without comprimising capabilities then this is it. I love it. The only thing I would like is for Samsung to start including a screen protector, they already have a marketing version so why not let the box do that and just simply include one. But functionaly I have nothing.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: my daughter loves playing games on this, and at 4 it is not too large for her. it is very portable. I can just put it in a pocket. fast. good screen. sturdy. good price. i definitely appreciate being able to load data on a memory card and plop it into the tablet. so far so good.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: The small size
Cons: Nothing
I was looking for a tablet that would be easy carry all the time. I have a lot of files that I need to reference while out. All functions work great and connection speeds were good. I connect through my phones hot spot.
Accessories are a little slim but its about the same size as a Fire so I found a very good leather cover made by M-Edge Incline for the Kindle Fire was a perfect fit and works great. I also got the SD Card reader and again works great.
Bottom line it works for what i wanted

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: great size and expandable storage
I initially bought the Galaxy Tab 10.1. But it was kind of cumbersome and inconvenient. I was so pleased to learn about the 7 plus. The deciding factor that determined whether I was going to purchase the 8 inch or the 7 inch was that this one is the only one that had a SD memory card slot for additional expandable storage. Also, I love the flexabiity of the android OS. The size is perfect and doesn't make my hands and arms tired.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Great bang for your buck
Cons: Hard to find cases for it.
I've had a few 7 inch tablets. And this is one of the best in the 7 Inch variety. It has a good processor and the usual 1gig of ram. Also Samsung has perfected there touch screen technology so your interaction with the tablet is smooth and quick responsive. Which is actually hard to find nowadays. I would like to see tablets increase the ram eventually but as of right now 1gig seems to be the standard right now. Also the battery life is fairly decent. There is a newer Samsung 7 inch tablet coming out and it looks like the specs on the 7.0 plus is better than the new galaxy 2.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: First of all, love the service from Bestbuy. I oredered the tab from Bestbuy.com to ship to store on Monday got a confirmation that it was there the next day. Excellent service with that. This definitely beats the ipad. Its like any smartphone on the big screen. You can do everything you can on a phone, but ofcourse the phone calls i guess. Everything is great on it. I would get this 100% not too big not too small great size screen. I have nothing bad to say about this item. Excellent product from Samsung and Excellent service from Bestbuy.com and the Bestbuy store#106. Get it!!!!(:

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I got it as a gift from my boyfriend and love it so much. Its very convenient, fast, it is so easy to use and it seems like Samsung has hought about everything you would need in a tablet. Love it!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Good enough to convert an apple fan
Item.Review: I've been an Iphone user for a few years now so I was a bit hesitant to try an android tablet as an Ipad would be the more natural choice. I was wrong and I'm quite impressed with both the Samsung hardware and the android software. Android does away with some of the things that bugged me about IOS and the hardware feels almost as good as an apple product. It's not perfect (multitasking can slow it down a lot) but for the price it's easily a great choice and well worth the money.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact
Cons: Unreliable
Twice we purchased an IPad2 and twice we returned it because we just couldn't justify the price. I bought this device thinking I was making a good price/value decision, but this device is very buggy. I've had it about 30 days and already have a dead pixel. It has locked up many, many times. It has refused to turn on entirely at times. Do yourself a favor - pay the extra $150 and get the Ipad2.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: everything
Cons: touch screen sometimes
Hubby got me one for Christmas. Cant put the thing down and now hes sorry he bought it!! Haha!! Its a lot of fun, very easy to use, and you can do anything on it that you want. Great great great awesome fun!!!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: The galaxy plus is a well built fully functional tablet. The size is perfect and I would never consider a kindle. Four those who know why Android is better you may want to hold off on this. Developers put more attention on larger tablets and you may have to wait a while for a decent ICS ROM. I feel it is worth the wait and I enjoy it as is. Just can't wait to upgrade the OS and ditch Samsung's bloatware.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Cons: Small Text Size,
I bought the Samsung just because it had the IR to control my media center. It was very hard to setup my Dish Network DVR. After getting the TV and Stereo set to where they worked I found there was very little information to find TV Programing. Once I found a program I wanted to watch, after selecting the program on the Samsung, It turned off my TV and Receiver. I can use my Cell Phone to control my Dish DVR with the Dish App better than this IR Remote.
One thing I was hoping to get from the 7" Screen was larger text than on my Droid Cell Phone. Some of the pages did not allow any pinch to zoom and I needed my glasses just to read them. I don't have perfect vision but I can read normal newspaper print without my glasses.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Very cool device that makes using a tablet simple
Item.Review:
Pros: Simple to use!
Cons: Locked up once, had to go online to learn how to unlock it.
Purchased this item as a gift. My friend just loves the product, it is very simple to use & very easy to carry. He has used it everyday since he received it, and has not had any problems so far. It is fast, convenient & fun to use. I will continue to buy Samsung products as they are dependable & state of the art technology!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Great hardware except the wifi
Cons: Disappointing wifi renders it mostly useless
Pros: When you're near the source of a wifi signal it's fast (loading apps, web browsing, general operations), touch response is crisp, light weight with slim dimensions, beautifully stylized design.
Cons: First and foremost, the wifi reception is awful. Have an airport extreme at my house and this thing struggled to get a signal where other devices routinely have no connectivity issues. For the premium Samsung charges for this and the quality of all the other parts, the shamefully weak wifi is inexcusable.
Considering the highly competitive landscape in the tablet market, an oversight like the wifi is inexcusable (Some of the best 10" tablets can be had at this time for as l ... ittle as $50 more). It is a "wifi" tablet and with spotty reception it is simply one of the nicest and most expensive IR remote controls or alarm clocks on the market. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: smaller size and external memory
Cons: proprietary charging cable
Love the smaller size and external memory. Only criticism is the proprietary charging cable, wish it had a simple micro USB. Be careful when buying accessories, make sure they are for the Galaxy Tab PLUS.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
I just want to list out the pros and cons.I think I should not have bought this one now....
Pro Battery Life is good if taken good care. Audio and video quality is superb excellent ergonomics feature loaded
Cons (giving you here what the customer care representatives of samsung informed me) Cannot add more screens - so you have to manage with only 5 that it comes with
Cannot move any files or apps except pictures from ur tab to sd card
On the whole its very annoying not to have these options- I think I should return this tab and rather go for another good one

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: just picked it up today and it is awesome. Easy to start. Lots of apps. Expandable memory. If you want something smaller than an Ipad and bigger than an ipod touch, this is it. The google music app beats everything.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Size and Quality
Cons: Auto Brightness, Remote, Web Video Playback
I really wanted to like this tablet, but had many small issues with it. The size is right and it feels well built. I wanted a a device big enough to easily use the internet and small enough to comfortably use as an e-reader. The built in universal remote was a big plus. The first problem I had was the auto screen brightness. The screen changed from bright to dim and back again for no apparent reason. This was solved by turning it off and picking a set level. The Peel remote is cool. It gives you a list of shows currently on cable based on your preferences. You can change the channel by just picking the shows icon. The problem I had was the app kept crashing. Moving through the DVR menu was al ... so more difficult then on the Comcast remote, plus the remote could not change my TV's input. Web video playback was almost unwatchable. Streaming mp4's and Hulu videos were fine, but I'm guessing it has a problem with Flash playback. There is one spot on the back of the device that gets fairly warm. Unfortunately, it's right where you hold the tablet to use it as an e-reader. You can turn it upside down, but then the volume controls and power butten are hitting the palm of your hand. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: everything specially the screen resolution
Cons: nothing
love my new samsung galaxy 7plus because it is an amazing new high tech gadget. Fast, reliable, outstanding screen resolution, speedy, useful, fantastic and no words to describe. People out there still thinking which tablet to buy, I suggest this tiny thing and you won't regret it. For myself this is my gift for christmas and also this is my favorite toy next to my nikon camera. Thanks Samsung for giving Apple the competition.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I purchased this tablet today. I own several tablets to include the acer a500, a100, blackberry playbook and a archos 5. This tablet is by far my favorite. It is considerably slimmer than any tablet I own. It feels very fast even though I experienced some lag when I used the touchscreen. The screen is bright enough and the battery life is decent. I am extremely impressed with how smooth videos are streamed through YouTube. Overall, a great tablet by Samsung. Compared to my other tablets, it is by far the most user friendly and powerful. I will update this review by the end of next week.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Very handy for news and web browsing
Item.Review:
I use mine every day, mostly for checking news and weather during breakfast.
Battery life is several days.
A downside is that occasionally it gets in a state where it won't even turn on without doing one of the reset-style key combinations. But this doesn't lose any data and is infrequent.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I ve had this Samsung 7 Tablet for around two weeks; everything works great! I had a hard time seeing my external 32G micro card, until I downloaded an app that worked great. Unlike a lot of other tablets, this comes wiht 3 appmarkets. I give it 5

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: fast, easy to use
Cons: battery life, home screen
Everything of this tablet is excellent, except the battery life is kindda short and you can not add more homescreen for your tablet

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to use. Great size. Fun!
Item.Review:
Pros: Good price, great size, easy to use
Cons: No online user guide.
Would like to have a user guide online for more information and for uses that I may have a question about. Overall, I love it!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Portability
Cons: Screen sensativity
Not wanting to spend 700.00 for an ipad we opted for the Galaxy Tab 7.0 plus. It has the best of both worlds. We can use it as a reader, surf the web at any wireless location without the monthly fees and contract. For the money it works for us

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Nothing
Very happy with the Galaxy 7 Plus. I have had a Pandigital Tablet for over a year. It was OK for what I wanted to do with it, although quite limited. The Galaxy is like being in another world. Even though I am not a computer nerd, I have found it quite easy to use. If one has any questions about the device, there is a 196 page Owners Manual to help out.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: I no longer use my laptop
Item.Review:
Pros: The touch screen is the best I've seen.
Cons: If I have to say something, fingerprints on the screen.
This is my second Android tablet, the first being a Micro Cruz just to see if a tablet was for me. Since purchasing the Samsung, my laptop is very rarely used at all. Netflix, You Tube, Facebook, banking, emails, all are now done on the new tablet. I've been using Samsung cell phones since 1997 and never had a failure, even with all the drops and one dunk in the pool. So I knew the quality would be there. You can't go wrong with this one.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I just purchased this after returning my nook tablet. I love it , it doesn't have to be rooted and I can read from amazon, nook, overdrive and kindle, just what I needed and the camera is a much added bonus.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I had a problem with a Dell Streak 7 where the camera would not focus on anything. Dell had just discontinued this item a month before I received it, so service was going to be questionable. I'm glad I was pushed to buying this tablet. It's also couple of ounces lighter than the DS7. I recommend it highly.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: If you have an android phone you will like this!
Item.Review:
Pros: Portability
This is basically a large android phone... It does everything that the phone does (except make phone calls) on a larger screen. Books, Music, wifi internet surfing.
If your looking for something to replace your laptop this really isn't it, but if you are looking for something for your media in a portable fashion this is perfect.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
I have formerly owned and iPad and a Blackberry PlayBook, but the 7 inch Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus is my favorite of the three devices.
Although the iPad is undoubtedly excellent, it's too big and too heavy to be used as my primary reading device.
The PlayBook is a good device, but the selection of apps is hopelessly bad.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: After doing multiple research on tablet pcs I came to the conclusion this one is the best. A bit pricey but worth the extra money indeed. This was purchased for my daugther's 13th birthday which has a few more weeks to get here so I can't comment on her views. One of the best parts is that it is NOT made in China! Believe that!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I have had pretty good experiences in the past with Samsung products...a few smartphones, a bluray player, a plasma TV. As much as I can praise the other products I own, I simply cannot do it for this device. I went through three of them before I finally gave up and got my money back. The first one had dead pixels...which is apparently considered acceptable by some manufacturers that obviously have lower quality standards than the customers buying their products. The second one had particles of dust all over the place under the glass screen. The third, which I checked in the store before I even bothered to bring it home, was also plagued with dust under the glass. For a company that has a pretty good reputation for the quality of their displays I was extremely disappointed. What is the poi ... nt of buying a device like this if the quality of the display is poor? I only gave it two stars rather than the minimum of one because it is actually designed well and it gets points for having an SD card slot. The android honeycomb operating system is nice too. But what good is it if the screen that displays it all is garbage? It almost looks as if someone with a bad case of dandruff was shaking their head over this thing as the screen was being installed. I had high expectations for this tablet. And some of them were actually met. However, they were grossly overshadowed by the fact that the screen is terrible. If you are interested in an android tablet...you will be better off looking elsewhere. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Best compact tablet on the market.
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Haven't found anything yet
After a false start with Kaspersky AntiVirus software (I loaded free Norton fine) that would not load, and a bad installation by Best Buy of my first screen (second screen installation was satisfactory), I still haven't stopped being amazed by this tablet's quality (the only Free World made 7" tablet Best Buy sells), speed, clarity and color crispness, and sheer volume of applications available. I later purchased a leather carrying case (originally made for the HTC Flyer, which I originally wanted to buy), and a USB adapter, both of which were well worth the added expense.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I was going to get the ipad, but after using my husbands i noticed that It wasn't really all the hype everyone was rating about. Apple products are so over rated. I love love love this. I've had it for 4mths and can't put it down. You have more free apps then the ipad.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I bought this as I was curious about the 7 inch form factor, an early iPad adapter and from a mac household, I admit that I did have my doubts about Android, however they quickly put to rest by my Samsung. I enjoy it's portability and can now carry it virtually everywhere I go. The build feels solid, the screen is bright, and the battery life gets me through a full day of light browsing and reading.I have managed to find either the same apps of suitable alternatives. Overall I very pleased. It has become my go-to tablet.Should also note that shipping was fast and painless even to Canada!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Perfect size- excellent small tab option
Item.Review: I really enjoy the screen quality, the effortless connectivity and the portability of this small tab. I also have a 10 tablet and i am using this one as my primary tool for work meetings and the like.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Nice Tablet, some shortages though
Item.Review:
Pros: size, plenty of apps, after market stuff
Cons: no Scrabble game, Samsung support site
the good; sound, display and 7" size are just right takes a 32GB MicroSD card keyboard works great, nice display, fast, huge assortment of apps on Amazon, Samsung, Android Market. Ebay and Amazon have a growing list of accessories available. Purchasing apps from The Market place or Amazon is good because it keeps track of your purchases, in the event that you need to reset the unit as I did, back to day 1, which is very easy and fast, quite painless, it was able to easily re-install all the apps I had previously purchased.
the bad; the cost no USB connection, no written/ hard-copy manual, (but then who does, give one anymore) I could not register this ... product online, via the Samsung site it would not recognize my serial number, I had to call. Hence Samsung website is poor, My wife and I enjoy Scrabble, my wife has a Nook, she has Scrabble, I purchased a version from Amazon which ran fine for several weeks then stopped working. and I cannot get it to work anymore. Indeed now Amazon site says the game is not compatible with my machine, although it is shown in my purchase history at Amazon.. I then downloaded a free version which is worthless, only fills a third of the display, very disappointing. I purchased Monopoly from The Android Market, it does not work, the download keeps going around and around. not much help from EA Sports either, the vender. I purchased the same game from Amazon and it works fine.
aside from the above annoyances I do like the Samsung Tab 7 Plus. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast
Cons: Buggy
The tv remote function only worked for about 30 minutes. My tab also rebooted two or three times a day. Returned it for the 8.9 and could not be happier.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Convenient size compared to bulky ipad
Item.Review:
Pros: Convenient size
Cons: none at this time
I use this for everything that I can do online, on the go, checking email and social networks, watching videos, doing trade, typing documents, efaxing, wireless printing, playing games and reading mobile e-books, and I love that it fits descreetly in my purse, without bulking.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.ReviewTitle: Love the small size literally handheld
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Software Bundle; Good Compatibility; Fast; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Adequate Storage
Cons: Turns off by itself
I'm in college and find this helpful for reading pdf files on the go or quickly browsing through the web. I also like to use it to read ebooks, news, and download music quickly. The two downsides that bother me at times is that it sometimes randomly restarts itself and the battery life is nothing compared to an ipad's battery life needs to be charged every day.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Size
Cons: Have to buy accesories to connect to computer
It runs ok but it does not have 8 GB in RAM as the Best Buy page specifies, it only has 1 GB, this could have been an important advantage against other tablets.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: so far everything
Cons: like I sad , seperate the speakers net time !
I owned the orignal Galixy Tab and I am impressed with the improvements , first this unit is 1/3 thinner and far lighter than the original. The screen is bright and clear, video play is exceptional as is the web browsing over wifi , that 8GB or RAM really makes a difference, this tablet also plays several formats of video including, Divx, AVI, WMV, Xvideo.. There is one interesting feature on this unit and when I saw it I wasn't quite sure what it was for, but this unit has a IR interface that allows you to use the tablet as an advanced remote control , I set it up , which by the way was easy , and it really works ! , battery life is adaquate for it's size , maybe about 8 hours, my only beef is .. why ... put both speakers on the same side ?? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Hardware: Solid no real issues. Everything feels and looks great.
OS: Its honeycomb with Touchwiz but Samsungs skin is not intrusive.
Operation: almost perfect. Fast and sliky smooth. Sensitive at times.
Overall: I have had the Acer A500, Transformer, Xoom Family Ed., and HTC Flyer. Oh a Touchpad too. By far this is the best 1 reason. EVERYTHING WORKS OUT OF THE BOX. Only drawback is that its kind of hard to type.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: Nice features, easy to use and does Kindle, Nook and library loans seamlessly. Battery life not great, but I always have the charger available.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: Right size to carry about - not too big like the iPad. Great screen for reading books, email etc. Good speed. Can't wait for the update to ICS.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: it's size, and versatility
Cons: that it's only wifi
i love my galaxy tab i just tought it would be 3G and it's not, but besides that it's really good

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I am a big fan of this tab. I love the size of this thing. I tried the fire and nook tablet, but they were to limited. This can do all I want and more.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything I need to keep organized anywhere I go.
Cons: Nothing I can think of.
Best purchase I have made when it comes to an electronic device.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: it s like brandnew

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: Great little unit, did not want to buy 10 to carry around. Skype works great, system needed update. Updated without a problem

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: This is the best tablet ever.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: Does everything that a tablet should do and more. Conveient and fun. THe only down part is that it has no sim card slot.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: i just like to downlaod games from market and play and also take on road when im passanger i love it

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I am impressed with this tablet. I was originally going to get a Kindle Fire. I decided to get this for the extra money because it does so much more.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: The tablet was delivered as advertised, the tablet was in prestine condition. I am truly enjoying this product.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: Excellent gadget for everyday use, very user friendly,very satisfied with it!

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review: I bought the tablet for my wife's birthday. She uses it to play games with our grandkids and keep track of missionaries we support. I love watching her use it.

Item.Item: Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0 Plus WiFi 16 GB - Metallic gray
Item.Review:
Pros: Small enough to carry in my purse but works like a laptop.
